## Video Resources

The [General Social Survey (GSS) YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/@GSS_NORC/playlists) has an educational video series designed to support instructors, students, and researchers using GSS data.

The following videos provide an overview of the General Social Survey (GSS), from survey design and sampling to data access and instructional use.

| Video | Description |
|:---|:---|
| [Introduction to the GSS](https://youtu.be/jBb2mCmCcOk) | Brief overview of the GSS, including its history, key stakeholders, and selected academic contributions. Positions the GSS as a widely used data resource for undergraduate instruction and research. |
| [GSS Project Process & Life Cycle](https://youtu.be/0TfXz3rhEeA?si=HE26cddySUzYl5OH) | Explains the full lifecycle of the GSS survey, including proposal review, testing, programming, pilot studies, data collection, cleaning, dissemination, and user support. |
| [The GSS Structure & Basics](https://youtu.be/YAsUcXed-nI?si=MnZ-uld-IkRzqVQm) | Describes the structure of the GSS, including core content, experiments, cross-sectional and panel studies, ISSP modules, and the balloting process. Covers basic skills for navigating, downloading, and interpreting GSS data. |
| [Sampling in the GSS](https://youtu.be/NiDYfhtRZ2U?si=_bxyBpN7TPLZhQgK) | Explains how representative samples are drawn for the GSS and introduces key sampling concepts used in the survey. |
| [Total Survey Error in the GSS](https://youtu.be/2IW1Vg-8-bw?si=wTsDwu5nog4d_HFC) | Discusses sources of error in survey data, including nonresponse error, coverage error, sampling error, and measurement error. |
| [GSS Wording Experiments](https://youtu.be/x0IMspZwIdI?si=k4KMgy4LSDW4xV1r) | Provides examples of how question wording affects responses, highlighting GSS contributions to understanding measurement effects (e.g., national spending priority items). |
| [The GSS Data Explorer](https://youtu.be/-sOcDPrytkY?si=38ve_G-BS0JC16ms) | Tutorial on using the GSS Data Explorer, including online analytics, visualizations, and features introduced in Data Explorer 2.0. |
| [GSS for Educators](https://youtu.be/zCaISoNIDQk?si=JbRMwIzBDCErcaRn) | Targeted to instructors; shares ideas for incorporating GSS data into lesson plans and classroom activities. |
| [GSS for STEM](https://youtu.be/I94Do1Lwm_o?si=_IU1797Tucivypqe) | Focuses on working with data beyond survey responses, including paradata and linked datasets such as the death index. |
| [Taking a Deep Dive into GSS Content](https://youtu.be/VmOvWq7OYFs?si=IPmmSW9_0S4QZ2zL) | Overview of major variable groups and content areas, highlighting resources and recent trends relevant to researchers and educators. |
